title: Ukip's only MP Douglas Carswell announces he's quitting the party - and insists there's no need for by-election
text:

Ukip's only MP Douglas Carswell has announced he is quitting the party and will sit in the House of Commons as an independent. 
Mr Carswell, 45, said he was leaving "amicably" and that there will be no need to call a by-election in his Clacton constituency. 
It comes after a public spat with Ukip's biggest financial backer Arron Banks , a close ally of former leader Nigel Farage, who suggested this month that he could trigger a by-election in Clacton using a recall petition and stand against Mr Carswell. 
It came over a row within Ukip about whether Farage deserved a knighthood . 
Announcing his resignation on his blog, Mr Carswell said Ukip has now achieved its goal of getting Britain out of the European Union, with Theresa May poised to trigger Article 50 to begin Brexit on Wednesday. 
He said while Ukip has not won many seats in Parliament, "in a way, we are the most successful political party in Britain ever". Arron Banks, Ukip's main donor, threatened to stand against Mr Carswell in his Clacton constituency (Photo: PA) Read More 'Anti-establishment' Nigel Farage squirms as he's asked 6 TIMES about wanting a knighthood 
Mr Carswell sent shockwaves through Westminster in 2014 when he defected from the Tories to Ukip. 
Mr Carswell paid tribute to party members and supporters, adding: "Like many of you, I switched to Ukip because I desperately wanted us to leave the EU. 
"Now we can be certain that that is going to happen, I have decided that I will be leaving Ukip. 
"I will not be switching parties, nor crossing the floor to the Conservatives, so do not need to call a by-election, as I did when switching from the Conservatives to Ukip. 
"I will simply be the Member of Parliament for Clacton, sitting as an independent. 
"I will leave UKIP amicably, cheerfully and in the knowledge that we won." 
Mr Carswell won a 3,437-vote majority in his constituency in the 2015 general eleciton. Like us on Facebook
